docs.title: 🟪 MODMIX Wiki
docs.text: Welcome to the official MODMIX Wiki. Find commands, FAQs, and guides for every MODMIX server.

docs.title: Server Addresses
docs.text:
• OG Factions: play.modmix.studio
  • Survival SMP: survival.modmix.studio
  • Cobblemon: pokemon.modmix.studio
  • Discord: discord.gg/6BMT3mfnfs

docs.title: About MODMIX
docs.text: MODMIX is a community-first network with no pay-to-win. Cosmetic ranks are earned in-game via /rankup (requirements: MCMMO power + in-game currency + 30 XP levels).

docs.title: Servers
docs.text:
• OG Factions — OG-style factions with mcMMO, manual raiding, and classic cannoning. Version: 1.21.8.
  • Survival SMP — Vanilla+ with light QoL.
  • Cobblemon — Pokémon + land claims + light economy.

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• OG Factions
  • Survival SMP
  • Cobblemon
  • Raiding & Cannoning Guide
  • General FAQ

docs.title: Cobblemon
docs.text: IP: pokemon.modmix.studio Core: Cobblemon Fabric modpack with land claims, shops, and keep inventory ON.

docs.title: Core Commands
docs.text:
• /rtp — Random teleport.
  • /sethome / /home — Save and return to your spot.
  • /pvp — Toggle PvP.
  • Claims (Golden Shovel, /flan): Right-click two corners to define your claim.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Keep Inventory: ON
  • Land Claims: Golden Shovel system.
  • Economy: Shulker Shop for backpacks and key items.

docs.title: FAQs (Cobblemon)
docs.text:
How do I protect my base? Use the Golden Shovel to claim land, then manage trust for friends.

Where do I buy backpacks and items? Check the Shulker Shop (server economy).

docs.title: OG Factions
docs.text: IP: play.modmix.studio Version: 1.21.8 (Sora/Paper/Purpur/Sakura fork) Focus: mcMMO, manual base building, classic raiding, cosmetic rank progression via /rankup (no P2W).

docs.title: Core Commands
docs.text:
Factions - /f create <name> — Create your faction. - /f invite <player> — Invite a player. - /f join <faction> — Join a faction. - /f claim / /f unclaim — Claim or unclaim territory. - /f map — View borders on the map. - /ftop — View faction rankings.

Economy & Utility - /shop — Open the server shop. - /baltop — Balance leaderboard. - /spawn, /sethome, /home — Travel and set home. - /rankup — Earn cosmetic rank (VIP → VIP+ → MVP → MVP+ → MVP++). - /server cannon — Go to the Cannoning Server (creative plots).

docs.title: Spawners: How They Work
docs.text:
• Natural spawners (found in world structures) do not drop when mined or exploded.
  • Player-placed or shop-bought spawners do drop and can be mined (no Silk Touch required).
  • In enemy-claimed land, you cannot mine spawners with a pickaxe. Use creeper eggs or TNT.
  • Exploded stacks drop one spawner, not the entire stack.

docs.title: Raiding & Cannoning (Basics)
docs.text:
• TNT settings (live server): Spread: NONE, Flow: OFF, Parity: ON.
  • No glitching, duping, or exploit-based entry.
  • Cannons are allowed; use the Cannoning Server to test long-range shots and timings.
  • See the full Raiding & Cannoning Guide.

docs.title: Ranks (Cosmetic, Earned In-Game)
docs.text:
• Progress with /rankup after meeting:
  • Required mcMMO Power
  • Required in-game currency
  • 30 XP levels
  • Ranks: VIP, VIP+, MVP, MVP+, MVP++ (purely cosmetic; no gameplay advantage).

docs.title: FAQs (OG Factions)
docs.text:
Do I need Silk Touch for spawners? No. Player-placed/shop spawners are mineable without Silk Touch. Natural spawners never drop.

How do I test cannons? Use /server cannon or the Cannoneer NPC at spawn to access the Cannoning Server (creative plots).

Are there restrictions on raiding? Play fair: no glitching or exploits. TNT and creeper eggs are allowed as tools for raiding.

docs.title: Is MODMIX pay-to-win?
docs.text: No. All ranks (ranks only in OG Factions) are cosmetic and earned in-game via /rankup. Requirements include mcMMO power, in-game currency, and 30 XP levels.

docs.title: How do I report bugs or issues?
docs.text: Use the #support channel in our Discord: discord.gg/6BMT3mfnfs

docs.title: Where can I test cannons safely?
docs.text: Use /server cannon or the Cannoneer NPC at spawn to reach the Cannoning Server (creative plots). It mirrors live TNT behavior (Spread: none, Flow: off, Parity: on).

docs.title: Do natural spawners drop when mined?
docs.text: No. Natural spawners never drop. Player-placed or shop-bought spawners do drop and can be mined without Silk Touch.

docs.title: Are there rules against exploits?
docs.text: Yes. Exploits, dupes, and glitch entry are prohibited across the network. Play fair.

docs.title: Server IPs
docs.text:
• OG Factions: play.modmix.studio
  • Survival SMP: survival.modmix.studio
  • Cobblemon: pokemon.modmix.studio

docs.title: Contact & Community
docs.text: Join the Discord for announcements, events, and support.

docs.title: Cannoning Server (Testing)
docs.text:
• Access: /server cannon or talk to the Cannoneer NPC at spawn.
  • Mode: Creative plots dedicated to cannon testing.
  • Version: Sora 1.21.8 (Paper/Purpur/Sakura fork).
  • Settings (test parity with live):
  • TNT Spread: NONE
  • TNT Flow: OFF
  • TNT Parity: ON

These settings are designed to mirror live raiding behavior, so your timing and sand stacks behave consistently.

docs.title: Live Server Notes (OG Factions)
docs.text:
• Natural spawners never drop; player-placed/shop spawners do.
  • In enemy land, use creeper eggs or TNT to break spawners; stacks drop one.
  • No glitching or exploit-based entry. Play fair and strategic.

docs.title: Helpful (Allowed) Player Mods
docs.text:
• Litematica — Plan builds and cannon layouts. No printer.
  • Replay Mod — Record raids for review and content.
  • Lightweight HUD / status mods — Armor, durability, coords.

Tip: Test long-range sand stackers on the Cannoning Server to validate TNT timing at distances before committing on live.

docs.title: Basic Raiding Flow
docs.text:
1. Scout — Map borders, identify weak points, water placement, and claim layout.
  2. Stage — Gather TNT, sand, creeper eggs, and supplies near target.
  3. Build — Assemble cannon; confirm chunk alignment and world border proximity.
  4. Test — Fire with reduced TNT to confirm tick timing and sand behavior.
  5. Breach — Increase to raid charge, monitor stack height and wall regen (if any).
  6. Secure — Control access, disable defenses, loot efficiently.

For server etiquette and enforcement, see the General FAQ.

docs.title: Survival SMP
docs.text: IP: survival.modmix.studio Style: Vanilla+ with light QoL and optional PvP.

docs.title: Core Commands
docs.text:
• /sethome — Create a home point.
  • /home — Teleport to your home.
  • /tpa <player> — Send a teleport request.
  • /tpaccept — Accept a teleport request.
  • /pvp — Toggle PvP on/off for yourself.
  • /spawn — Return to spawn.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Mostly vanilla gameplay with a few QoL commands.
  • PvP is opt-in using /pvp.
  • Balanced economy and light community rules.

docs.title: FAQs (Survival)
docs.text:
Is keep inventory on? No, Survival runs a traditional survival loop. (Cobblemon has keep inventory ON.)

How many homes can I set? Default is two homes for convenience.

How does PvP work? It’s off by default. Use /pvp to opt in.
